name: Hotel LP Santa Cruz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given LP is number one on Tripadvisor, we were upset that our Travel Agent inadvertently put us in Hotel Cortez (No 5). Then they moved across town from Cortez to LP and we wish we'd stayed where we were. Yes, Cortez is slightly more money, but it is definitely better. All the white in LP feels a bit clinical and the overabundance of questionnaires asking "How are we doing?" seems somewhat overwhelming. Situated a minimum 10 minute taxi ride outside of downtown makes commuting a necessary, especially as nearby restaurants are few. Wi-fi is strong. Bathroom & the shower very good. Room cleanliness more than acceptable. Lack of a personal safe in the room is a pain as lodging important items in and out with Reception is a long process. Staff are young but enthusiastic and helpful. Breakfast buffet standard stuff. Watch out for that very strong coffee. Just wish it had all been a bit more natural. All seemed to be trying so hard to meet the criteria on the questionnaires
reviews.title: Clinical but good

reviews.text: As a buisness travler this hotel does the trick. Its cheap, ideally located, and new. It doesn't have any ammenities, so if your looking for a vacation spot then maybe stay at the cortez or the camino real.
reviews.title: Does the trick

reviews.text: However if your looking for something that works well in the basics, this is your best bet. You'll end up paying double for an old moldy room simply to have a half decent pool and questionable gym equipment.
reviews.title: Modern, clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is fit for a peasent, some pieaces of semifresh fruit, and scraps of ham and cheese, make sure to have a good lunch a few hours after your tiny breakfast.
reviews.title: A fairly good stay

reviews.text: The hotel offers a car service for 99 BOB, if its your first time in Bolivia and you want somone there waiting for you then ok, but if not or your more of an adventurer then just take the airport cabs outside.
reviews.title: Clean, basic, modern hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just for 1 night. Very tired from the airplane trip we decided to take a nap between 6pm to 7pm, but a regional band was rehersaling in the room next to ours... We called the front desk but they weren't very willing to help us resolve the situation...
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay here - the rooms are lovely, the amenities are excellent and the staff are friendly. Be sure to have your paperwork in order and with you to avoid paying more than you should.
reviews.title: A very nice quality hotel in Santa cruz

reviews.text: The breakfast was very nice. Location wise it is a little far from the plaza but still a pretty decent location.
reviews.title: 4 stars service for a 3 stars price

reviews.text: Honestly, this is the best hotel you can find in Santa Cruz for that price.
reviews.title: Ideal for short business trip

reviews.text: this is my qualification and opinion
reviews.title: Beware of the manager and the front desk employees

reviews.text: The hotel is fairly basic and doesn't have a very warm decor. I'm not sure the cold, clinical look and feel of the hotel was a consequence of not having the money to dress it up a little or because they had a bad interior designer. The manager likes to call the look "minimalist," I would call it stark and unappealing.
reviews.title: OK hotel, a bit off the beaten track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My main problem with the hotel, like the headline of this post says, is that it's not close to anything in SC and it's in a pretty tawdry part of town. There is a football stadium of some sort across the street.
reviews.title: Good value, modern feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went out quite a few times while there and every single time upon returning to the hotel, the taxi driver had a hard time finding the hotel even though I had the street address written on a piece of paper (and I speak Spanish). Although the hotel's business card was available at the front desk complete with a city map and location printed on the back side, the map was for the hotel's other property in La Paz! I didn't realize this until I had already left the hotel one evening with the card and was preparing to return after a long night in town.
reviews.title: Great value for money and lovely staff

reviews.text: On the bright side, the price was right and the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. But I probably won't stay there again. I'm pretty much sold on the Hotel Cortez.
reviews.title: Basic but clean and friendly staff

reviews.text: I stayed at LP twice whilst in Santa Cruz – once in a regular room and once in a suite. In Santa Cruz, I’d previously stayed in very low budget and very high end hotels, and LP compared very favorably to both on value and overall experience.
reviews.title: Value for price, attentive staff, good design

reviews.text: I got in quite late on my flight - it's about a 20 min drive in taxi from the airport. The staff were very friendly (I didn't get the names), however I was told that they didn't have my hotel reservation. (I had booked on hotwire 24 hours before.) They sorted it out after a few minutes delay and helped me up to a room with my luggage. I asked if there was anywhere to get food, as I hadn't eaten dinner - and they recommended a pizza place with which they cooperate. (Was supposed to be a 1 hour wait, I didn't get the pizza until almost two hours. This isn't the hotel's fault, but keep it in mind if you're needing to sleep and hungry.) Breakfast is available at 7am, but I missed it because I had to leave at 6:30. There was nowhere else to get food.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, friendly staff, needs touch-up

reviews.text: I would say the hotel looks exactly as shown in the hotel pictures except it looks worn down. Needs a fresh coat of paint, for sure. The shampoo container was broken in my room and quick fix glue was sloppy, so some quick fixes like this made certain spots look a little extra worn. At the entrance the doors were stuck open and so there were tons of little bugs landing on me and dead on the floor around the entrance. Also, the website lists that there is a shuttle between the hotel and airport -- but it's taxi and you do have to pay.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great value for money.

reviews.text: The lights turn on and off depending on movement, to save electricity. The hotel seems very environmentally friendly.
reviews.title: A GOOD SURPRISE

reviews.text: I know it sounds like quite a few negatives, but they're just little things. My sleep was comfortable and the beds were clean, the shower was hot, and the staff were great. I'd just say they need some touch up on the hotel to freshen things up and to maybe sync in a little better with the online booking services, if they are going to use them.
reviews.title: Decent, Not a World Class Hotel

reviews.text: Started badly having arrived and reception had no record of my booking, I was told that the suite I had booked was not available. I was shown a twin room which just wasn't what I wanted. The reception staff were apologetic and promised to look into what had gone wrong. After a short period they came back and said that they had found the reservation in booking.com the website through which I had booked and that they had managed to juggle things around and now a suite was available. They were very apologetic and helpful, especially Gustavo and Juan Manual who couldn't do enough for us. The suite is really great value for money at about £55 a night and definately worth the additional cost over a standard room. Breakfast was fine with a different daily local hot dish each day. The hotel is looking a little tired in places but nothing a lick of paint wouldn't sort out. Overall I would recommend this place as I think it's great value for money and the staff are all so lovely and friendly.
reviews.title: Good value in Santa Cruz

description: A new 3 stars Hotel located in Santa Cruz de la Sierra Down Town in a quiet neighborhood. Our hotel offers a pleasant stay, with all the facilities to enjoy a city that gives visitors a personal taste of politics, culture, art and nature.Property StatisticsYear build: 2008Our top markets: Tour Operators, Travel Agencies, CorporateNumber of Rooms: 40Number of Suites: 4Meeting Rooms: 1Restaurant: 1Bar: 1
